Articles.Content:
the unmanned control module called "probodobodyne okto2" is not working properly for me. it's supposed to have auto-turn normal/antinormal and auto-turn radial/anti-radial capability,like a 3-star pilot, but clicking the buttons on the screen does NOTHING! it doesn't even have auto-turn prograde/retrograde capability!

to be honest, I don't use radial or normal much anyway, but auto-retrograde is VERY useful for landing.

sorry if this is the wrong place, i didn't see any "bug report" area.

Hi eric bloedow.

Do you have a reaction wheel or RCS thrusters and monopropellant?

Even a gimballing engine will do, as the Octo2 does not have any means to turn itself, all it can do is use other parts to steer with.

description = The OKTO2 is far more than a flatter variant of the original OKTO. This new iteration of the ubiquitous 8-sided probe core features a much more advanced guidance system. This new model however, does not feature built-in reaction wheels and does requires more power to run, even on standby. Its internal battery supply is also very limited, being intended mainly to keep the Standby LEDs lit.

What about electric charge?

Please post pictures of the vessel with the resource tab open (top right) to imgur.com and your output_log.txt from KSP_Data to a file share or test paste site such as dropbox.com or hastebin.com

See the support stickies for details.
